name: Kinetic Thinking Style Assessment
shortDescription: Discover how you engage with entrepreneurial situations

dimensions.name: Uncertainty Attitude
dimensions.description: How you approach new, uncertain situations

dimensions.name: Possibility Attitude
dimensions.description: How you deal with new information

quadrant1.name: Breakaway
quadrant1.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to (1) consider options based on identified gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible; and (2) deliberate action based on seeking new stimuli and setting things in motion for the sake of discovering something interesting. Your strength is in seeking new frontiers and painting a visionary future, and making sense of the situation. You would not be 'boxed' into structures or procedures and tend to focus on what they miss or prevent.

quadrant2.name: Incremental
quadrant2.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to (1) consider options based on identifying gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible; and (2) deliberate action based on careful assessment of its merits and prospects. Your strength is in finding weakest links, areas for improvement, and immediate action steps. You are keen to close gaps, maintain a sense of movement, and define constant progress.

quadrant3.name: Focused
quadrant3.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to (1) consider options based on clearly defined goals or a sense of purpose; and (2) deliberate action based on careful assessment of its merits and prospects. Your strength is in organizing information and making sense of the situation. You are keen to determine and agree goals and develop benchmarks against which to evaluate options and assess progress.

quadrant4.name: Playful
quadrant4.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to (1) consider options based on clearly defined goals or sense of purpose; and (2) deliberate action based on seeking new stimuli and setting things in motion for the sake of discovering something interesting. Your strength is in provoking the world the respond, in putting things into play. You are keen to work with something tangible, to experiment, and to see where this takes you.

borderNorth.name: Kinetic within openness (Incremental and Breakaway)
borderNorth.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to consider options based on identifying gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible. In deliberating action, you show flexibility between (1) a careful assessment of its merits and prospects, and (2) seeking new stimuli, setting things in motion to discover something interesting. Your strength is in identifying areas for improvement and seeking new frontiers. You are keen to close gaps, maintain a sense of movement, and define constant progress. You tend not be 'boxed' into structures or procedures and tend to focus on what they miss or prevent.

borderSouth.name: Kinetic within structure (Focused and Playful)
borderSouth.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you tend to consider options based on clearly defined goals or a sense of purpose. In deliberating action, you show flexibility between (1) a careful assessment of its merits and prospects, and (2) seeking new stimuli, setting things in motion to discover something interesting. Your strength is in organizing information and making sense of the situation. You are keen to determine and agree goals, but you are also comfortable to put things into play and see where this takes you.

borderWest.name: Kinetic within reason (Focused and Incremental)
borderWest.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you show flexibility in considering options based on (1) clearly defined goals or a sense of purpose and (2) identifying gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible. You deliberate action based on careful assessment of its merits and prospects. Your strength is in organizing information, making sense of the situation, and finding areas for improvement. You are keen to determine and agree goals as well as to keep moving and making progress.

borderEast.name: Kinetic within play (Playful and Breakaway)
borderEast.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you show flexibility in considering options based on (1) clearly defined goals or a sense of purpose and (2) identifying gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible. You deliberate action based on based on seeking new stimuli and setting things in motion for the sake of discovering something interesting. Your strength is in provoking the world the respond, in putting things into play, in seeking new frontiers and in painting a visionary future. You are keen to work with something tangible, to experiment, and to see where this takes you.

center.name: Fully kinetic thinker
center.description: When facing new ideas or situations, you show flexibility in considering options based on (1) clearly defined goals or a sense of purpose and (2) identifying gaps and a sense of what is missing or what else is possible. In deliberating action, you show flexibility between (1) a careful assessment of its merits and prospects, and (2) seeking new stimuli, setting things in motion to discover something interesting. You find strength and equal comfort in organizing information and agreeing goals, keeping on the move to make progress, seeking new frontiers, and experimenting with something tangible, to see where this takes you.

homePage.title: Kinetic Thinking Style Assessment
homePage.subtitle: Discover how you tend to engage with entrepreneurial situations. How do you respond when you need to step off the beaten path?

assessmentDetails.heading: Assessment Details:
items: 12 randomized question pairs, in two parts
Remember: There are no right or wrong answers!

homePage.footer: Your privacy is important to us. All assessment data is securely processed and stored.

assessment.title: Kinetic Style Assessment

partIntros.part1: When engaging with new ideas, how do you tend to move forward?
partIntros.part2: When encountering new information, how do you tend to process it?

assessment.instructions: Use the slider or click the bars above to select a response that reflects your hunch

metadata.description: Two-dimensional kinetic thinking style assessment with 4 focused categories
